lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use conditional rendering to show the loaded planets if they are available.

Make sure to pick planets, followed by &&, and finally planets.map.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the purpose of the fetch API?

To retrieve data from a serverTo update component stylesTo manage rendering componentsTo update state variables

To retrieve data from a server.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to load data from the API.

Make sure to type await.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the keyword await do in JavaScript async functions?

It pauses execution until the promise is resolvedIt declares an asynchronous functionIt skips the current promiseIt returns a promise object

It pauses execution until the promise is resolved.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Put the async and await code in a try block to catch potential errors and display an error message if needed.

Make sure to pick try followed by catch and then error, if, error.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Try to fetch data from an external API and handle any errors in the catch block.

Make sure to pick ( followed by error and then ), =>, setError, error.message.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens if the server responds with an error while fetching data and you have a catch block implemented?

The catch block will be executedThe then block will continue executing uninterruptedIt will automatically retry the requestThe finally block will be executed

The catch block will be executed.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Extract the query parameter "genre" from the URL and display it in the component.

Make sure to pick genre followed by query and then .get, "genre", genre.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will the value be when the URL is https://my-react-app.com?page=home and the component uses query.get("feature")?

null"home""page""feature"

Make sure to pick null.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Access the name property of the received data and use it to update the state variable.

Make sure to pick setCharacter, followed by data.name.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which statement is true about using async and await and .then chaining in the context of fetch?

Both handle async operationsYou must use async and await if you want to handle errors.then requires less memoryasync and await is not compatible with useEffect

Both handle async operations.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Finish the code to implement error handling when fetching data.

Make sure to type catch.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Fetch from an API and manage state with useState.

Make sure to type fetch.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Write code to fetch data from an API and save the error in the state variable error when one is caught.

Make sure to type setError.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the purpose of throw new Error("error")?

To trigger the catch block if the response is not successfulTo log a message before fetching the dataTo retry the fetching processTo continue execution without interruption

To trigger the catch block if the response is not successful.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Access two query parameters named "artist" and "album", then display them.

Make sure to pick query followed by . and then get, (, "artist", ), query, ., get, (, "album", ).

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Given a component using const theme = query.get("theme"), what will {theme || "default"} be the accessed value when the URL is https://my-react-app.com?color=blue?

"default""theme""color"Error

Make sure to pick "default".

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a route to render a Contact component inside our app.

Make sure to pick <Route followed by path= and then "/contact", element=, {, <Contact />, }, />.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which component is used to define paths in react-router-dom?

RouteSwitchPathRouter

Make sure to pick Route.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add a new link that renders the Contact component.

Make sure to type to.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What component should be imported and used to ensure that certain pages are accessible only when the path matches?

LinkNavLinkRouteBrowserRouter

Make sure to pick Route.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Define the root route for the Home component.

Make sure to type path="/".

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the primary purpose of the BrowserRouter component in a React application?

To enable navigation between different URL pathsTo create Redux actionsTo manage component stateTo fetch data from APIs

To enable navigation between different URL paths.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the useNavigate hook to navigate to the "/contact" route when a button is clicked.

Make sure to pick goToContactPage followed by navigate and then (, "/contact", ), goToContactPage.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the benefit of using useNavigate over using the Link component?

It allows programmatic navigation with more control over the navigation processIt automatically fetches data when navigatingIt transforms URLs to lower caseIt adds a CSS class to the active link

It allows programmatic navigation with more control over the navigation process.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Render the Dashboard component for the root route.

Make sure to pick element followed by = and then {, <Dashboard />, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Finish the code to add a link to the root path.

Make sure to type to="/".

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the useLocation hook to check the current location path and display it in your app.

Make sure to pick location followed by useLocation() and then location, .pathname.
